citations.narrative:
The facility has not maintained complete acquisition and disposition records for twenty one cats and two dogs. Acquisition
and disposition records concerning each live dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired are necessary to accurately
track and identify animals being used in regulated activities, as well as aid in the detection of movement of animals upon
relocation to a new site.
The facility shall make, keep and maintain records that fully and correctly include all the required acquisition and
disposition information, including: the name and address of the person from whom the animals were acquired, the USDA
license number of the person if licensed or the vehicle license number and state and driver’s license number and state if
not licensed, the name and address of the person to whom an animal was given/sold, the date of acquisition or
disposition, and description of each dog or cat as outlined in this subpart.
Correct by July 16, 2025.

The facility's annual report for the previous 2023 federal fiscal year was not submitted by the required deadline of
December 1 to the Deputy Administrator. The facility submitted their annual report on December 5, 2024. Appropriate
submission of the annual report in a timely manner is essential to evaluate the information provided in the reports and
assure the care and use of animals were followed according to the Animal Welfare Act regulations. Each reporting facility
shall submit an annual report, covering the use of live animals in the previous fiscal year, on or before December 1st of
each calendar year.
Correct by December 1, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.35(b) 
   
Recordkeeping requirements. 
The facility has not maintained complete acquisition and disposition records for twenty one cats and two dogs. Acquisition 
and disposition records concerning each live dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired are necessary to accurately 
track and identify animals being used in regulated activities, as well as aid in the detection of movement of animals upon 
relocation to a new site.  
The facility shall make, keep and maintain records that fully and correctly include all the required acquisition and 
disposition information, including: the name and address of the person from whom the animals were acquired, the USDA 
license number of the person if licensed or the vehicle license number and state and driver’s license number and state if 
not licensed, the name and address of the person to whom an animal was given/sold, the date of acquisition or 
disposition, and description of each dog or cat as outlined in this subpart. 
Correct by July 16, 2025. 
2.36(a) 
   
Annual report. 
The facility's annual report for the previous 2023 federal fiscal year was not submitted by the required deadline of 
December 1 to the Deputy Administrator. The facility submitted their annual report on December 5, 2024. Appropriate 
submission of the annual report in a timely manner is essential to evaluate the information provided in the reports and 
assure the care and use of animals were followed according to the Animal Welfare Act regulations. Each reporting facility 
shall submit an annual report, covering the use of live animals in the previous fiscal year, on or before December 1st of 
each calendar year. 
Correct by December 1, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
